name: Can I Park
description: Can I Park is an app aimed to help drivers in Stockholm to by-pass incomprehensivble parking signs and give the driver a simple answer whether it's allowed to park or not.
techDescription: The Frontend is written in React Native, optimized for iOS. The  map functionality comes from Mapbox and the relevant data is using Stockholm Stads open Parking API. The backend is a simple Express server using Axios to fetch data from Parking API and forwarding it to the frontend.

name: Happy Thoughts
description: Happy Thoughts is a messaging app resembling Twitter. It was an assignment as part of my Technigo Bootcamp. I took the opportunity to practice TDD using Jest.
techDescription: The Frontend is written in React, HTML and CSS. The backend is an Express server connected to a MongoDB database. The app is hosted at Heroku (backend), Mongo Cloud (backend) and Netlify (frontend).

name: Project Bomberdude
description: The project was part of a course in Uni I developed with a student colleague. It's dangerously similar to the classic game Bomberman and is played solo or vs another player.

name: Project Auth
description: A simple authentication service that hashes and salts the credentials in the backend and sending an auth token to the user.

name: Project Movies
description: Project Movies leverages the API from themoviedb.org to fetch and display the latest box office movies, using React Router to link to a details page.

name: Project Music
description: The project aim was to use data to create a responsive flexbox layout using React.

name: Project Resto
description: The project leverages the external restaurant API Zomato and presents it in an 'Uber eats' style format
